title: Geometric Shapes in Composition
description: A short lesson to help you apply Geometric Shapes in Composition.

hook.text: Triangles, circles, rectangles â€” your brain is wired to find shapes everywhere. Great photographers use that.

buildup.text: Shapes organize visual information. Triangles feel stable, circles feel complete, rectangles feel structured.

discovery.text: Three people form a triangle. A group around a table forms a circle. Architecture is full of rectangles.

twist.text: The shapes don't need to be obvious. Implied shapes â€” formed by placement of objects â€” work just as powerfully.

climax.text: Once you start seeing shapes in scenes, composition becomes intuitive. The geometry was always there.

punchline.text: The world is built on geometry. So are great photos.
